title: Replica Keldysh field theory of quantum-jump processes: General formalism and application to imbalanced and inefficient fermion counting
summary: Measurement-induced phase transitions have largely been explored for projective or continuous measurements of Hermitian observables, assuming perfect detection without information loss. Yet such transitions also arise in more general settings, including quantum-jump processes with non-Hermitian jump operators, and under inefficient detection.
